overview_of_class: The objective of this course is to provide the student with an understanding of the transportation industries in the United States and the major policy issues confronting government and the public. All modes of transportation will be considered: trucking, highways, mass transit, airlines, maritime, railroads, and pipelines. The course will acquaint the student with the underlying economics of transportation provision including: demand, costs, the economics of regulation and regulatory reform, the pricing and quality of service, subsidies, competition between the various modes, and the social appraisal of investment projects.
name: Transportation Economics and Public Policy
subject: ECON
